analyzed: ayam duḥkha vrāta vrata parigame pāraṇa vidhiḥ
translated: This is the rite of breaking the fast in the observance of the vow of the multitude of sufferings,

original: mahāsaukhyāsāraprasaraṇarase durdinam idam /🔽yad anyanyakkṛtyā viṣamaviśikhaploṣaṇaguror vibhoḥ stotre
analyzed: yat viṣama viśikha ploṣaṇa guroḥ vibhoḥ stotre
translated: This is the rainy season in the nectar of the outpouring of the essence of great bliss,🔽When the mind, free from fear, always reflects in the praise

analyzed: śaśvat pratiphalati cetaḥ gata bhayam  /
translated: Of the Lord, the teacher of the art of nourishing the uneven arrows by disparaging others.

original: vimṛśya svātmānaṃ vimṛśati punaḥ stutyacaritaṃ tathā
analyzed: vimṛśya sva ātmānam vimṛśati punar stutya caritam tathā
translated: Having contemplated on one's own self, one again reflects on the praiseworthy conduct,

analyzed: stotā stotre prakaṭayati bheda eka viṣaye
translated: And the praiser displays the object of difference in the praise.

analyzed: vimṛṣṭaḥ ca sva ātmā nikhila viṣaya jñāna samaye tat ittham
translated: And the self, having been contemplated, at the time of the knowledge of all objects, thus

original: tvatstotre 'ham iha satataṃ yatnarahitaḥ // //🔽anāmṛṣṭaḥ svātmā na hi bhavati bhāvapramitibhāj anāmṛṣṭaḥ
analyzed: tvad stotre ham iha satatam yatna rahitaḥ  an āmṛṣṭaḥ sva ātmā na hi bhavati bhāva pramiti bhāj an āmṛṣṭaḥ
translated: I am always free from effort in your praise here.🔽The self, not contemplated, does not partake of the ascertainment of existence, and

analyzed: sva ātmā iti api hi na vinā marśana vidheḥ
translated: Even the self, not contemplated, is not so without the injunction of contemplation.

original: śivaś cāsau svātmā sphurad akhilabhāvaikasarasas tato 'ham
analyzed: śivaḥ ca asau sva ātmā sphurat akhila bhāva eka sarasaḥ tatas ham
translated: And that self is auspicious, the sole essence of the sparkling of all existence, therefore

analyzed: tvad stotre pravaṇa hṛdayaḥ nitya sukhitaḥ  vicitraiḥ jāti ādi bhramaṇa paripāṭī parikaraiḥ avāptam
translated: I, with a heart inclined towards your praise, am always happy.

analyzed: sārvajñam hṛdaya yat ayatnena bhavatā
translated: The omniscience attained by you, O heart, effortlessly, through the various means of wandering through birth and so on,

analyzed: tat antar tvad bodha prasara saraṇībhūta mahasi sphuṭam vāci
translated: Within that, in your radiance, which has become the path of the flow of knowledge of you,

analyzed: prāpya prakaṭaya vibhoḥ stotram adhunā
translated: having attained it, O Lord, now manifest the hymn of praise.

analyzed: vidhunvānaḥ bandha abhimata bhava mārga sthitim imām  rasīkṛtya ananta stuti hutavaha ploṣita bhedām  vicitra sva sphāra sphurita mahima ārambha rabhasāt piban bhāvān
translated: Shaking off this state of being on the path of worldly existence, which is considered to be bondage,🔽having melted it with the fire of endless praise,🔽drinking these states

original: etān varada madamatto 'smi sukhitaḥ // //🔽bhava prājyaiśvaryaprathitabahuśakter bhagavato vicitraṃ
analyzed: etān vara da mada mattaḥ smi sukhitaḥ  bhava prājya aiśvarya prathita bahu śakteḥ bhagavataḥ vicitram
translated: with the enthusiasm of the wonderful manifestation of your greatness, O bestower of boons, I am intoxicated and happy.🔽If the wonderful

analyzed: cāritram hṛdayam adhiśete yadi tatas
translated: conduct of the Lord, whose many powers are renowned through abundant lordship, resides in the heart, then

original: kathaṃ stotraṃ kuryād atha ca kurute tena sahasā
analyzed: katham stotram kuryāt atha ca kurute tena sahasā
translated: how could one compose a hymn? But if one does so suddenly,
in the attainment of oneness with Śiva, the salutation to Śiva is the first means.

analyzed: jvalat rūpam bhāsvat pacanam atha dāham prakaṭanam
translated: The blazing form, the shining cooking, and the manifestation of burning,

original: vimucyānyad vahneḥ kim api ghaṭate naiva hi vapuḥ /
analyzed: vimucya anyat vahneḥ kim api ghaṭate nā eva hi vapuḥ
translated: apart from these, no other form of the fire can be accomplished at all.

original: stuve saṃvidraśmīn yadi nijanijāṃs tena sa nuto bhaven
analyzed: stuve saṃvid raśmīn yadi nija nijān tena sa nutaḥ bhaven
translated: If one praises the individual rays of consciousness, then by that he would be praised.

analyzed: na anyaḥ kaścid bhavati parameśasya vibhavaḥ
translated: There is no one else who is the glory of the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: vicitra ārambha tve galita niyame yaḥ kila rasaḥ
translated: The rasa that arises from the various beginnings, when the restrictions have dissolved,

analyzed: pariccheda abhāvāt parama paripūrṇa tvam asamam
translated: is unequalled in its supreme completeness, due to the absence of limitations.

analyzed: svayam bhāsām yogaḥ sakala bhava bhāva eka maya tā viruddhaiḥ
translated: The union of one's own manifestations, the oneness with all existing things,

analyzed: dharma oghaiḥ para citiḥ an argha ucita guṇā
translated: with contradictory qualities, the supreme consciousness, whose qualities are priceless,

original: itīdṛkṣair rūpair varada vividhaṃ te kila vapur vibhāti
analyzed: iti īdṛkṣaiḥ rūpaiḥ vara da vividham te kila vapuḥ vibhāti
translated: In this way, O bestower of boons, your various forms indeed shine forth,

original: svāṃśe 'smin jagati gatabhedaṃ bhagavataḥ /🔽tad evaitatstotuṃ hṛdayam atha gīrbāhyakaraṇaprabandhāś ca🔽syur me satatam aparityaktarabhasaḥ // //
analyzed: sva aṃśe smin jagati gata bhedam bhagavataḥ  tat eva etat stotum hṛdayam atha gīḥ bāhya karaṇa prabandhāḥ ca  syuḥ me satatam a parityakta rabhasaḥ
translated: in this world, which is a part of yourself, O Lord, free from distinctions.🔽My heart and my external organs of action🔽may always be devoted to you, O Lord, in order to praise you.

analyzed: tava eva ekasya antar sphurita mahasaḥ bodha jaladheḥ
translated: From the ocean of consciousness, which is your own inner radiance,🔽the various waves spread forth naturally.

analyzed: vicitra ūrmi vrāta prasaraṇa rasaḥ yaḥ svarasataḥ  te eva amī sṛṣṭi sthiti laya maya sphūrjita rucām
translated: They are indeed the manifestations of creation, preservation, and dissolution,

analyzed: śaśāṅka arka agnīnām yugapad udaya apāya vibhavāḥ
translated: with the splendor of the moon, the sun, and the fire, simultaneously arising, disappearing, and possessing power.

analyzed: atas citra a citra krama tad itara ādi sthiti juṣaḥ vibhoḥ śaktiḥ
translated: Therefore, the power of the Lord, which enjoys the states of various, various sequences, and other states,

original: śaśvad vrajati na vibhedaṃ katham api /
analyzed: śaśvat vrajati na vibhedam katham api
translated: nevertheless, somehow does not fall into distinctions.

original: tad etasyāṃ bhūmāv akulam iti te yat kila padaṃ
analyzed: tat etasyām bhūmau akulam iti te yat kila padam
translated: O Bhairava, Lord, that state which is said to be beyond this stage,

analyzed: tat ekāgrībhūyāt mama hṛdaya bhūḥ bhairava vibho
translated: may that be the object of my single-pointed concentration, may that be the object of my heart.🔽From that complete state, you manifest your own power,

original: amuṣmāt saṃpūrnāt vata rasamahollāsasarasān nijāṃ śaktiṃ🔽bhedaṃ gamayasi nijecchāprasarataḥ /
analyzed: amuṣmāt saṃpūrnāt vata rasa mahā ullāsa sarasāt nijām śaktim  bhedam gamayasi nija icchā prasarataḥ
translated: which is full of the great delight of rasa, through the flow of your own will.

analyzed: anargham svātantryam tava tat idam ati adbhuta mayīm
translated: Your priceless freedom is indeed this,

analyzed: bhavat śaktim stunvan vigalita bhayaḥ haṃ śiva mayaḥ
translated: I, free from fear, extolling your wonderfully marvelous power, am full of bliss.

analyzed: idantāvat rūpam tava bhagavataḥ śakti sarasam
translated: This form of yours, O Lord, full of the essence of power,

analyzed: krama abhāvāt eva prasabha vigalat kāla kalanam
translated: is, due to the absence of sequence itself, suddenly free from the calculation of time.

original: manaḥśaktyā vācāpy atha karaṇacakrair bahir atho ghaṭādyais
analyzed: manaḥ śaktyā vācā api atha karaṇa cakraiḥ bahis atho ghaṭa ādyaiḥ
translated: With the power of the mind, with speech, and with the circle of senses, and also with external things like pots,

analyzed: tad rūpam yugapad adhitiṣṭheyam aniśam
translated: I would constantly abide simultaneously in that form.

analyzed: krama ullāsam tasyām bhuvi viracayan bheda kalanām
translated: O God, manifesting the conception of difference in that stage by creating a sequence,

original: svaśaktīnāṃ deva prathayasi sadā svātmani tataḥ /🔽kriyājñānecchākhyāṃ sthitilayamahāsṛṣṭivibhavāṃ trirūpaṃ
analyzed: sva śaktīnām deva prathayasi sadā sva ātmani tatas  kriyā jñāna icchā ākhyām sthiti laya mahā sṛṣṭi vibhavām trirūpam
translated: you always proclaim your own powers within yourself.🔽May I, with an attentive heart, become the threefold form

analyzed: bhūyāsam samadhiśayitum vyagra hṛdayaḥ
translated: consisting of the powers of action, knowledge, and will, which is the power of preservation, dissolution, and great creation.

original: purā sṛṣṭir līnā hutavahamayī yātra vilaset
analyzed: purā sṛṣṭiḥ līnā hutavaha mayī yā atra vilaset
translated: Before creation dissolves, may this fire-like manifestation of yours shine forth,

analyzed: para ullāsa aunmukhyam vrajati śaśi saṃsparśa subhagā
translated: Delightful by the touch of the moon, inclined towards the highest delight,

analyzed: hutāśa indu sphāra ubhaya vibhava bhāj bhairava vibho tava iyam
translated: O Bhairava Lord, possessing the glory of both the fire and the moon,

analyzed: sṛṣṭi ākhyāḥ mama manasi nityam vilasatām
translated: May this creation always shine forth in my mind.

analyzed: visṛṣṭe bhāva aṃśe bahis atiśaya āsvāda virase yadā
translated: When the emitted part of existence, having a taste for extraordinary enjoyment, is outside,

analyzed: tatra eva tvam bhajasi rabhasāt rakti maya tām
translated: If you then quickly take on a form full of passion,

original: tadā raktā devī tava sakalabhāveṣu nanu māṃ kriyād
analyzed: tadā raktā devī tava sakala bhāveṣu nanu mām kriyāt
translated: Then may the red goddess surely make me passionate in all your emotions,

analyzed: rakta apāna krama ghaṭita goṣṭhī gata ghṛṇam
translated: Compassionate towards those gathered in the assembly formed by the red drinking practice.

original: bahir vṛttiṃ hātuṃ citibhuvam udārāṃ nivasituṃ yadā
analyzed: bahis vṛttim hātum citi bhuvam udārām nivasitum yadā
translated: When you wish to abandon external activity and dwell in the vast realm of consciousness,

analyzed: bhāva abhedam prathayasi vinaṣṭa ūrmi capalaḥ
translated: Unstable like a wave, manifesting the oneness of existence,

original: sthiter nāśaṃ devī kalayati tadā sā tava vibho sthiteḥ
analyzed: sthiteḥ nāśam devī kalayati tadā sā tava vibho sthiteḥ
translated: Then the goddess of stability perceives the destruction of your stability, O Lord,

original: sāṃsārikyāḥ kalayatu vināśaṃ mama sadā // //🔽jagatsaṃhāreṇa praśamayitukāmaḥ svarabhasāt
analyzed: sāṃsārikyāḥ kalayatu vināśam mama sadā  jagat saṃhāreṇa praśamayitu kāmaḥ sva rabhasāt
translated: May she always bring about the destruction of my worldly stability.

analyzed: sva śaṅkā ātaṅka ākhyam vidhim atha niṣedham prathayasi
translated: Desiring to pacify the world through destruction, you then proclaim the method called self-doubt, and prohibition.

original: yamaṃ sṛṣṭvetthaṃ tvaṃ punar api ca śaṅkāṃ vidalayan
analyzed: yamam sṛṣṭvā ittham tvam punar api ca śaṅkām vidalayan
translated: Having created Yama in this way, you again dispelled doubt,

analyzed: mahādevī sā iyam mama bhava bhayam saṃdalayatām
translated: And this great goddess, may she dispel the fear of worldly existence for me.

original: vilīne śaṅkaughe sapadi paripūrṇe ca vibhave gate
analyzed: vilīne śaṅkā oghe sapadi paripūrṇe ca vibhave gate
translated: When the multitude of doubts has dissolved, and when wealth is fully attained,

original: lokācāre galitavibhave śāstraniyame /🔽anantaṃ bhogyaughaṃ grasitum abhito laṃpaṭarasā vibho
analyzed: loka ācāre galita vibhave śāstra niyame  anantam bhogya ogham grasitum abhitas laṃpaṭa rasāḥ vibho
translated: When worldly conduct has lost its wealth, and when the rules of scripture have been transcended,🔽O Lord, may the goddess called Samhara, with her greedy nature,

analyzed: saṃhāra ākhyā mama hṛdi bhidā aṃśam praharatu
translated: Devour the endless stream of objects all around, and strike the part of division in my heart.

analyzed: tat ittham devībhiḥ sapadi dalite bheda vibhave
translated: Thus, when the goddess has quickly shattered the power of division in this way,

analyzed: vikalpa prāṇā asau pravilasati mātṛ sthitiḥ alam
translated: The state of the mother shines forth, with imagination as its life-force.

analyzed: atas saṃhāra aṃśam nija hṛdi vimṛśya sthiti mayī
translated: Therefore, having contemplated the part of dissolution in one's heart, and being established in that state,

analyzed: prasannā syāt mṛtyu pralaya karaṇī me bhagavatī
translated: May the blessed goddess be pleased, causing the dissolution of death.

analyzed: tat ittham te tisraḥ nija vibhava visphāraṇa vaśāt avāptāḥ
translated: Thus, these three, by the power of expanding their own glory,

original: ṣaṭcakrakramakṛtapadaṃ śaktaya imāḥ /🔽kramād unmeṣeṇa pravidadhati citrāṃ bhavadaśām imābhyo
analyzed: ṣaṭcakra krama kṛta padam śaktayaḥ imāḥ  kramāt unmeṣeṇa pravidadhati citrām bhava daśām imābhyaḥ
translated: Have attained these powers, which are arranged in the sequence of the six cakras.🔽By gradually opening up, they create the wonderful state of existence.

analyzed: devībhyaḥ pravaṇa hṛdayaḥ syām gata bhayaḥ
translated: With a heart inclined towards these goddesses, may I be free from fear.

analyzed: imām rundhe bhūmim bhava bhaya bhidā ātaṅka karaṇīm imām
translated: I block this earth, which causes fear and terror to the world, and

analyzed: bodha ekānta druti rasa mayīm ca api vidadhe
translated: I also make it full of the essence of the sole delight of enlightenment.

analyzed: tat ittham saṃrodham drutim atha vilupya aśubha tatīḥ
translated: Thus, having quickly destroyed the blockage and fluidity, and the inauspicious rivers,

original: yatheṣṭaṃ cācāraṃ bhajati lasatāṃ sā mama hṛdi // //
analyzed: yatheṣṭam ca ācāram bhajati lasatām sā mama hṛdi
translated: May that (consciousness), shining brightly, enjoy the conduct as desired in my heart.

analyzed: kriyā buddhi akṣa ādeḥ parimita pade māna padavīm avāptasya
translated: Of action, intellect, senses, etc., which has attained the state of limitation,

analyzed: sphāram nija nija rucā saṃharati yā
translated: It withdraws the vast radiance of each one.

original: iyaṃ mārta /ṅdasya sthitipadayujaḥ sāram akhilam haṭhād
analyzed: iyam mārtaṅdasya sthiti pada yujaḥ sāram akhilam haṭhāt
translated: This (consciousness), forcibly drawing out all the essence of the one united with the state of existence of the mortal world,

original: ākarṣantī kṛśatu mama bhedaṃ bhavabhayāt // //🔽samagrām akṣālīṃ kramavirahitā sātmani muhur
analyzed: ākarṣantī kṛśatu mama bhedam bhava bhayāt  / samagrām krama virahitā sā ātmani muhur
translated: May it diminish the difference of me, afraid of worldly existence.🔽Having repeatedly placed the entire, unbroken, and unsequential (series of letters) within itself,

analyzed: niveśya ananta antar bahalita mahā raśmi nivahā
translated: With a multitude of extremely large rays extending to infinity,

original: parā divyānandaṃ kalayitum udārādaravatī prasannā me
analyzed: parā divya ānandam kalayitum udāra ādaravatī prasannā me
translated: May the supreme, divine bliss, which is full of great reverence, be pleased for me,

analyzed: bhūyāt hṛdaya padavīm bhūṣayatu ca
translated: And may it adorn the path of my heart.
When the means of knowledge is merged, due to the power of the splendor of the state of Śiva,

analyzed: śarīra prāṇa ādiḥ mita kṛtaka mātṛ sthiti mayaḥ
translated: The body, life-force, etc., which are of limited nature, are in the state of the mother (Prakṛti).

original: yadā kālopādhiḥ pralayapadam āsādayati te tadā devī yāsau
analyzed: yadā kāla upādhiḥ pralaya padam āsādayati te tadā devī yā asau
translated: When the limiting adjunct of time reaches the state of dissolution, then that Goddess

original: lasati mama sā syāc chivamayī // //🔽prakāśākhyā saṃvit kramavirahitā śūnyapadato
analyzed: lasati mama sā syāt śiva mayī  / prakāśa ākhyā saṃvid krama virahitā
translated: who shines forth, may she be full of auspiciousness for me.🔽Consciousness, known as light, free from sequence, completely absorbed outside from the state of emptiness,

analyzed: bahis līna atyantam prasarati samācchādaka tayā
translated: spreads forth as the all-covering.

analyzed: tatas pi antar sāre galita rabhasāt a krama tayā mahākālī
translated: Then, from that too, within the essence, with the speed gone, in a non-sequential way, Mahākālī

original: seyaṃ mama kalayatāṃ kālam akhilam // //🔽tato devyāṃ yasyāṃ paramaparipūrṇasthitijuṣi kramaṃ
analyzed: sā iyam mama kalayatām kālam akhilam  tatas devyām yasyām parama paripūrṇa sthiti juṣi kramam
translated: may this one, calculating all time for me.🔽Then, in that Goddess who enjoys the state of supreme fullness, having quickly interrupted the sequence

original: vicchidyāśu sthitimatirasāt saṃvidadhati /🔽pramāṇaṃ mātāraṃ mitim atha samagraṃ jagad idaṃ sthitāṃ
analyzed: vicchidya āśu sthiti mati rasāt saṃvidadhati  pramāṇam mātāram mitim atha samagram jagat idam sthitām
translated: and established herself with intense delight,🔽may my mind, having embraced the entire world as the means of knowledge, the mother, and the measure,

original: kroḍīkṛtya śrayatu mama cittaṃ citim imām // //
analyzed: kroḍīkṛtya śrayatu mama cittam citim imām
translated: take refuge in this consciousness.

analyzed: anargala sva ātma maye maheśe tiṣṭhanti
translated: In that great Lord, who is full of his own nature without obstruction,

analyzed: yasmin vibhu śaktayaḥ tāḥ
translated: in whom those all-pervading powers abide,

analyzed: tam śaktimantam praṇamāmi devam
translated: I bow to that powerful God,

analyzed: manthāna saṃjñam jagat eka sāram
translated: known as Manthāna, the sole essence of the world.

analyzed: ittham sva śakti kiraṇa ogha nuti prabandhān ākarṇya deva
translated: Having heard these hymns of praise consisting of the rays of my own powers,

analyzed: yadi me vrajasi prasādam
translated: if the God shows me grace,

analyzed: tena āśu sarva janatām
translated: then may he quickly make all people

analyzed: nija śāsana aṃśu saṃśāntita akhila tamaḥ paṭalām vidheyāḥ
translated: and the darkness of all obstacles should be completely pacified by the rays of your own command.

analyzed: ṣaṭṣaṣṭinām eke varṣe navamyām asite hani
translated: In the sixty-sixth year, on the ninth day of the dark fortnight,

analyzed: mayā bhinavaguptena mārgaśīrṣe stutaḥ śivaḥ
translated: I, Abhinavagupta, have praised Shiva in the month of Margashirsha.

analyzed: iti śrī abhinavagupta pāda ācārya kṛtam kramastotram sampūrṇam
translated: Thus ends the Krama Stotra composed by the venerable teacher Abhinavagupta.

analyzed: gandharvanagaram
translated: Gandharva City.
